humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: According to the pathology report, there is one out of four lymph nodes positive for metastatic carcinoma in specimen number 7. This corresponds to N1 based on the AJCC staging system (New Rule 12: N1 indicates metastases in 1 to 3 axillary lymph nodes). The report also mentions that one lymph node in specimen number 7 contains micrometastatic carcinoma, which is consistent with the diagnosis of N1.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The N stage for cancer is determined by the involvement of lymph nodes. In this report, the patient has one out of four lymph nodes positive for metastatic carcinoma in specimen number 7 (1/4). Therefore, the N stage for this patient is N1.
